sentences: Charley Jordan (January 1, 1890 â€“ November 15, 1954) was an American St. Louis blues singer, songwriter and guitarist, as well as a talent scout, originally from Mabelvale, Arkansas, United States.
Jordan recorded numerous singles for Vocalion and Decca between 1930 and 1937, and also performed with some well-regarded bluesmen from the 1920s to the 1940s.
Noted for his "crisply firm guitar", he had most of his biggest hits, including "Keep It Clean", in the early to mid-1930s.
Later in that decade and into the 1940s, he worked frequently with Big Joe Williams.
In 1928, Jordan was shot in the spine, this was due to his extramusical career as a bootlegger.
Jordan died of pneumonia in 1954 in St. Louis, Missouri.
